People who sign their posts. (I like trains. -SomeRandomUser9002) We can see your username, guys. Stop cluttering up threads.

Bronies/MLP

If you're a 7 year old girl watching MLP, I'm perfectly fine with that. If you're a 17 year old guy who is obsessed with it, then prepare for me to get very politically incorrect and very blunt very fast (like I will now).

I don't care about being intolerant or offensive: the fact that a 17 year old boy likes this show is just weird. It is also annoying how said 17 year old boy is willing to defend his bronie-ness to the death. By doing so, the only point he is proving is that of the non-bronies/haters (a.k.a: sane people): that he is a weird immature creep. Also, not everything needs to have ponies in it.

Examples:

Back to the future=awesome. Buck to the future=Nooo! *headdesk

Dr. Who=cool. Dr.hooves=stupid

KSP=insanely awesome. Pony SP= Instant annihilation by Jeb.

Bronies/MLP

If you're a 7 year old girl watching MLP, I'm perfectly fine with that. If you're a 17 year old guy who is obsessed with it, then prepare for me to get very politically incorrect and very blunt very fast (like I will now).

I don't care about being intolerant or offensive: the fact that a 17 year old boy likes this show is just weird. It is also annoying how said 17 year old boy is willing to defend his bronie-ness to the death. By doing so, the only point he is proving is that of the non-bronies/haters (a.k.a: sane people): that he is a weird immature creep. Also, not everything needs to have ponies in it.

Examples:

Back to the future=awesome. Buck to the future=Nooo! *headdesk

Dr. Who=cool. Dr.hooves=stupid

KSP=insanely awesome. Pony SP= Instant annihilation by Jeb.

you can think what you want just don't force others to think like you.

Edit: I think this quote does it better

MLP:FiM is one of my most favorite shows of all time. I adore the characters, the writing, and the scenarios these characters are put in. It's a very good, well animated show that hearkens back to old saturday morning cartoons in some ways, and modern cartoons in others.

It's just a fun show, with plenty of good moral lessons and excellent presentation. Anyone who's irate about the bronies breaking a gender boundary should check back into the 1950s. People will always like something you dislike, that's a fact of life, and the mature thing to do would be to simply accept it.

In detail, Season 1 was a great start, 2 was extremely strong from start to finish (Especially finish! Dat finale, however d'aw it was..!) and 3 was -okay-, and the coinciding film, "Equestria Girls" was. Uh. Well. Extremely meh. Derpy or Fluttershy is also best pony. After months of waiting for ponies, here I am once again, every saturday afternoon, watching a show I genuinely enjoy.

There are not many things that really, truly make me happy. This is one of those things, and no single force on earth could take that from me. None should. I enjoy science fiction of several types, transhumanism theory, cybernetic research and development, and advanced in medicine that make humanity a better, more worthwhile species to be a part of. I also enjoy space, and almost anything involving it.

But I also happen to enjoy a fun, cute, enjoyable show about small pastel horses, and this unnerves a few people I know. It makes me sad, not for myself, but for them, that they're so hung up that they must ridicule someone for something they believe as childish and ridiculous, when they themselves have their own childish or ridiculous interests, because if there is one truth, being an adult doesn't take away with little bit of you is still a ten year old kid that just likes to have fun.

For what it's worth also, MLP:FiM has introduced me to several extremely nice people who are all but family to me at this point, has helped me be more comfortable in my identity, and has made me a generally happier, more open person. It came at a crucial point in my life, and it'll always have a special place in my heart for that. It's given me common interest with countless people I would call friends, perhaps to the end, and that alone is worth the ridicule of those around me in my personal life.

This is not my final post on this matter. This is not me giving an ultimatum, or brokering a deal.

This is me simply saying, I am who I am, any and all of us are, and nothing, noone, can change that. That should never happen.

tl;dr, I like ponies and if that's not okay with you, put on your big boy pants and accept it, or don't. It doesn't matter to me and nothing can change it.

I hate it when this girl charolette says that Justin Bieber is amazing and that NASA is a bunch of idiots. God, this is why ksp was made- to show people space exploration is important and to kill astronauts willy nilly.

What really grinds my gears is the fact that society is the one to decide what I am allowed to like and dislike, and I am to have no say in the matter. I think it's weird and odd that teenagers/men watch a tv show for little girls, but I am proud to be weird. At least I'm an individual who can make their own decisions on what they like and dislike and not under the influence of social pressures. Like awsumindyman said a brony will defend themself to the death so there is really no point in hating on us is there?

"It's weird to not be weird" - John Lennon

I think Bronies are pretty flippin wierd, however I only dislike those that can't shut the hell up about it.

I mean its the same reason nobody likes Jehovah.

People who fail to really learn about something and they either create their own evidence or they use a rumor they heard to defend their claim. Especially when it involves space flight. I am tired of telling people that rocket launches are not the thing eating up the national budget. The worst was when someone tried to tell me it takes $60 to fill up his car so space flight must be expensive because of the fuel. Then again this is the same guy who claims martians are real and that is why we never have been to Mars. Despite me telling him about the four rovers.
You know those times when you spend an hour building a piece of rocketry beauty only to have physics rip it apart on the launch pad.
When my shirt spontaneously combusts when i'm doing the Greek mythology dance.

People neglecting the word "are".

"The rockets is launching!"

Abuse of the word "Like".

Especially when it is used more than 10 times in a 30 word sentence.

What really grinds my gears is the fact that society is the one to decide what I am allowed to like and dislike, and I am to have no say in the matter. At least I'm an individual who can make their own decisions on what they like and dislike and not under the influence of social pressures.
